results.firPara: Gareth Bale said that qualification for the knockout stage of Euro 2016 with Wales sits alongside anything he has achieved with Real Madrid and he also described Mondays emphatic victory over Russia that secured their place in the last 16 as one of the best team performances he has ever been involved in.
results.secPara: On a memorable and historic night for Welsh football, Russia were beaten 3-0 in Toulouse, with Aaron Ramsey, Neil Taylor and Bale scoring the goals that enabled them to take advantage of Englands failure to beat Slovakia and finish as the Group B winners, setting up a last-16 tie against one of the third-placed qualifiers at the Parc des Princes on Saturday.
results.webTitle: Gareth Bale: Wales win ‘was one of the best performances I have been part of’

results.firPara: Psephologists are unconvinced that former England stars support for remain will swing voters in favour of staying
results.secPara: Psephologists are unconvinced that former England stars support for remain will swing voters in favour of staying
results.webTitle: Experts doubt impact of David Beckham's EU vote intervention

results.firPara: Jürgen Klinsmanns team face one of the worlds best sides for a place in the final. But Lionel Messi and Co can be put off their stride with a few key tactics

results.firPara: Veteran defender has been playing his club football in Australia and so nearly quit the international game, but could yet be part of a Northern Ireland squad that reaches the last 16
results.secPara: Five years ago, Aaron Hughes had had enough. Northern Ireland were going nowhere fast Nigel Worthingtons team had won one game in 12 months – against the Faroe Islands – and qualification for Euro 2012 was out of the question with two games remaining. The captain had been considering it for some time but, disillusioned after a 4-1 defeat to Estonia in September 2011, he thought the moment was right to retire.
results.webTitle: Aaron Hughes unemployed but ready to face Germany with Northern Ireland

results.firPara: • Portugal, Hungary, Iceland or Austria could all finish second in Group F
results.secPara: Englands failure to beat Slovakia on Tuesday night means they will be anxiously watching Wednesdays matches in Group F, arguably Euro 2016s weakest group, to discover their opponents in the second round.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: who will England face in the second round?

results.firPara: Tradition dictates that English top-flight managers, in tournament years, lazily do their summer scouting off the telly, idly mumbling he looks good from the back of a pub at the sight of a defender being able to pass the ball or a passage of purposeful attacking from someone or other. So it is that Chelsea are being linked not just with Leonardo Bonucci but with Antonio Candreva – and their manager should know a bit more about them than your average pub bore, as he already manages them. Yep, Antonio Conte is reportedly planning a £57m raid for the pair of them.
results.secPara: The question of where and how to play Paul Pogba may be vexing France at the moment, but Real Madrid have no such doubts. The European champions want him, and his agent Mino Raiola says talks have already happened.
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Paul Pogba to Real Madrid?

results.firPara: • Hodgson predicts glut of goals after more missed chances against Slovakia
results.secPara: Roy Hodgson has claimed his team selection did not constitute a risk as England passed up the chance to win Group B and the manager insisted his side had dominated all three fixtures in the section and would make someone pay.
results.webTitle: Hodgson defends Slovakia draw and says England will ‘make someone pay’

results.firPara: • Manager praises amazing performance as side moves into last 16
